title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
10:14 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vmassol> ok one more +1 for the docbook integration mail would be nice so that I can commit :)  
10:27 <vmassol> jvdrean, Denis, cjdelisle….  
10:34 <vmassol> good to know: http://olamy.blogspot.com/2011/10/new-default-https-transport-layer-in.html  
10:35 <vmassol> mflorea: nice doc, I just skimmed it ATM, need to find some quality time to read it now :)  
10:35 <vmassol> mflorea: one detail, we now have a scm macro that tmortagne did  
10:35 <vmassol> for ex: [[here>>https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/sheet/scripting/SheetScriptService.java]]  
10:35 <vmassol> can be written as:  
10:36 <vmassol> {{scm …}}here{{/scm}}  
10:36 <vmassol> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/SCM  
10:37 <+tmortagne> {{scm path="xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/sheet/scripting/SheetScriptService.java"}}here{{/scm}} ;)  
10:37 <vmassol> hehe was tpying it but you beat me  
10:37 <vmassol> wait you're missing a part  
10:37 <+tmortagne> nop  
10:37 <vmassol> {{scm project="xwiki-platform"  
10:37 <+tmortagne> it's the default :)  
10:37 <vmassol> I don't think it's good to have  a default for this…. but well...  
10:38 <+tmortagne> it's the most used so it's the default  
10:38 <vmassol> YMMV  
10:38 <+mflorea> cool, didn't know about the scm macro, I'll update the doc  
10:38 <+tmortagne> you can put it if you absolutely want to :)  
10:39 <+mflorea> vmassol: are you making the change?  
10:39 <+tmortagne> defaults:  
10:39 <+tmortagne> \* user -> xwiki  
10:39 <+tmortagne> \* project -> xwiki-platform  
10:39 <+tmortagne> \* branch -> master  
10:39 <+tmortagne> \* raw -> false  
10:41 <vmassol> mflorea: nope  
10:41 <vmassol> (sorry had the lock, released)  
10:42 <vmassol> :)  
10:47 <+tmortagne> looks like platform is stuck again in the same place  
10:48 <+tmortagne> (deploying a xar)  
10:50 <+mflorea> tmortagne: actually the scm macro didn't work without proiect="xwiki-platform"  
10:50 <+mflorea> the generated URL wasn't right  
10:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: there is working examples on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/SCM  
10:51 <+tmortagne> what was your use case ?  
10:51 <+tmortagne> {{scm path="xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/sheet/scripting/SheetScriptService.java"}}here{{/scm}} ?  
10:51 <+mflorea> yes  
10:51 <+tmortagne> checking  
10:51 <+mflorea> it generates https://github.com/xwiki/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/sheet/scripting/SheetScriptService.java  
10:52 <+mflorea> with project="xwiki-platform" it generates correctly http://www.github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/sheet/scripting/SheetScriptService.java  
10:53 <+tmortagne> it's a bug when both branch and project are ommitten, must be missing a if somewhere, fixing it  
10:55 <+tmortagne> mflorea: should be ok now  
10:56 <+tmortagne> the code is a bit... on the fly (to be nice)  
10:56 <+mflorea> :)  
11:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <+Enygma`> Hi mflorea, tmortagne, vmassol  
11:53 <+Enygma`> any problems regarding workspaces?  
11:54 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: appart from the dependency on EX ?  
11:54 <+tmortagne> XE  
11:54 <+mflorea> the main problem for me is the dependency to enterprise  
11:54 <+Enygma`> it's a dependency on the XE xar, not the war  
11:54 <+Enygma`> it should not cause a cyclic dependency issue. Is it causing any?  
11:55 <+Enygma`> it is not the case to create a new product since the main wiki is the same standard XE/XEM  
11:56 <+Enygma`> it's only the generated application artefacts (workspaces/subwikis) that are altered  
11:56 <+mflorea> first of all, platform shouldn't know there is an enterprise package. then, CI builds platform and enterprise continuously because platform triggers enterprise and not enterprise triggers platform  
11:56 <+mflorea> s/not/now  
11:58 <+Enygma`> a build on enterprise triggers a build on platform?  
11:58 <+Enygma`> didn`t we change that with the new layout?  
11:58 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: yes it's a cyclic dependency, how are we going to release platform if it depends on XE  ?  
11:58 <+mflorea> with your changes, yes  
11:59 <+tmortagne> the type of the project does not matter  
12:04 <+Enygma`> so the problem is that you can not just build from start to finish either the platform or the enterprise, because they have some interlinked modules that would require partial build of both.  
12:06 <+mflorea> yes  
12:06 <+tmortagne> technical or no it does not make any sense that platform depends on something that is by definition unknown at platform level...  
12:08 <+Enygma`> but then how does the enterprise and platform builds succeed on jenkins?  
12:10 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: I see it as platform deppending on an artefact that's supposed to be on the repository, much like any other dependency. In this case, it's an artefact produced by enterprise.  
12:10 <+Enygma`> now, if this causes cycles, then I agree that it's not good.  
12:10 <+tmortagne> it succeeded because XE xar was already built  
12:11 <vmassol> Enygma`: even if it didn't cause cycles it's not good, platform should never depend on XE  
12:11 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: I don't understand how you can see as something normal that platform depends on things that are produced by XE  
12:12 <+Enygma`> so tmortagne, on a clean repository, it would not succeed, right?  
12:12 <+tmortagne> yes it would not  
12:12 <+tmortagne> when you build platform it's not going to find XE stuff  
12:12 <+Enygma`> yes, you are right.  
12:13 <+Enygma`> I looked at it as artefacts, but should have looked at it as full releases.  
12:14 <+Enygma`> so the problem is the workspace-template module  
12:14 <+Enygma`> which generates a modified XE xar  
12:14 <+Enygma`> and the workspaces-ui module which uses that modified XE xar to attach it to the Install page.  
12:15 <+Enygma`> we could unlink the workspaces-ui and workspaces-template modules by not attaching it automatically, and leaving the user to do it  
12:15 <+Enygma`> but then the workspace-template module would still have to be outside platform`s build  
12:15 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: as I said in github something that needs XE xar looks like a distribution to me and not a platform module  
12:16 <+tmortagne> XE is just one distribution among others  
12:16 <+tmortagne> since it's in platform workspaces should work with anything  
12:16 <+Enygma`> an alternative could be a rewrite... I could put the extra pages and make the extra changes that I was doing by using velocity instead of a maven artefact  
12:17 <+Enygma`> at workspace creation time  
12:17 <+Enygma`> it's not elegant, but maven`s happy  
12:17 <+Enygma`> and it can take a regular XE xar as template instead  
12:17 <+tmortagne> or you can do that at XE level  
12:18 <+Enygma`> yes, the alternative is to add the workspace-template module as part of XE (if this is what you mean)... but isn't this a bit weird?  
12:19 <+Enygma`> since XE and workspaces are not exactly related  
12:19 <+Enygma`> if this is considered acceptable, then it might be the quickest solution.  
12:20 <+tmortagne> XE depends on workspaces so it knows about it  
12:21 <+Enygma`> I see...  
12:21 <+tmortagne> what is this xar used for ?  
12:21 <+Enygma`> template for the created workspaces (subwikis)  
12:21 <+tmortagne> then should be done at XEM level actually probably  
12:22 <+tmortagne> especially sicne XEm already have this xar...  
12:22 <+tmortagne> it's not very nice to have the XE xar in several pages  
12:22 <+Enygma`> well, this xar is diferent from XEM`s xar by the fact that it has some extra pages or some minor modifications.  
12:23 <+Enygma`> if I would go for the other alternative (the rewrite) then probably I could reuse XEM`s xar  
12:23 <vmassol> why do you need to depend on the XE XAR?  
12:23 <+Enygma`> a subwiki template xar is basically a regular XE xar + modifications  
12:23 <+Enygma`> thus I depend on the regular XE xar (with the maven approach)  
12:23 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: the only goal of XE xar in XEM is to provide a default template  
12:24 <+tmortagne> the fact that you added some page stil make it a duplicate  
12:24 <+tmortagne> so replace the one currently on by yours if you prefer  
12:24 <+tmortagne> but there should be only one IMO  
12:24 <+Enygma`> well, the goal of the template in workspaces is to be the only template used automatically when creating a workspace  
12:24 <+Enygma`> so the user does not choose (like in XEM) which template to use or what to import  
12:27 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: btw is workspaces included in XE ?  
12:28 <+Enygma`> no, it is just included in the platform. It is not bundled with XE  
12:28 <+Enygma`> it is to be installed as an extension by the user, per request  
12:28 <+tmortagne> ok so XE does not depends on it then  
12:28 <+tmortagne> so it should really not be done at XE level  
12:28 <+Enygma`> I guess it shouldn`t  
12:29 <+tmortagne> anyway it should noyt be packaged with XE for the same reason wiki manager is not  
12:29 <+Enygma`> yes  
12:29 <+Enygma`> so I`m only left with the rewrite alternative  
12:30 <+tmortagne> not even  
12:30 <+tmortagne> maven is not the issue  
12:30 <+tmortagne> moving the dependency from maven to velocity does not change anything for me  
12:31 <+Enygma`> well, it does not affect the build/release  
12:31 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
12:31 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <+tmortagne> again it's the build is not the issue  
12:31 <+tmortagne> workspaces is a platform module  
12:31 <+tmortagne> as such it should not know about XE  
12:32 <+tmortagne> anywhere that be pom.xml or velocity or anything  
12:32 <+Enygma`> well, then any of the platform modules should not know of any other projects outside the platform (junit, jmock, common-utils, etc)  
12:33 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: no  
12:33 <+tmortagne> theses are dependencies  
12:33 <+tmortagne> platform is a dependency of XE  
12:33 <+tmortagne> it not about what is outside of platform  
12:34 <+Enygma`> when handling it from velocity, I just treat it as an user given XAR that happens to be the XE xar  
12:34 <+tmortagne> cyclic dependency issue is not just some maven limitation  
12:34 <+Enygma`> but do know that this implies runtime stuff  
12:34 <+Enygma`> and at runtime all the builds are complete  
12:34 <+Enygma`> and the artefacts exist  
12:35 <+Enygma`> in build time, there was the cyclic problem  
12:35 <+tmortagne> have to go for lunch  
12:36 <+Enygma`> so the only solution right now as far as I can see (and have been told) would be a new product :|  
12:36 <+Enygma`> (if we completely reject the velocity approach)  
12:39 <+Enygma`> (lunch also)  
12:59 <vmassol> Enygma`: you need to make a proposal quickly about fixing this or we'll have to revert your commit since we need to release XE soon now and it's  no go if platform has a dep on XE  
13:17 <+Enygma`> back  
13:25 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <DrLou> has quit  
13:42 <+Enygma`> sent a vote request on the list  
13:43 <vmassol> guys fyi I'll be offline from 14:00 till 16:00, I'll reconnect after

14:07 <JuanDaugherty> is UTC or CET assumed here?  
14:07 <+Enygma`> I`m also offline for about 2hours. I`ll check the mail occasionally to follow on the vote and work offline based on the results.  
14:08 <+Enygma`> JuanDaugherty: I think he ment french time.  
14:08 <+tmortagne> JuanDaugherty: not really, when we don't say anything it's generally the french time (which is not very right)  
14:08 <JuanDaugherty> that's what I meant by CET, which is I believe UTC+1  
14:09 <+tmortagne> ok then :)  
14:10 <JuanDaugherty> a new version of XEM was scheduled for release today IIRC  
14:10 <+tmortagne> XEM is always release with XE  
14:10 <+tmortagne> and I think it will be delayed a bit  
14:10 <+tmortagne> not much change it's released today  
14:11 <JuanDaugherty> the download site still says 3.1 (rather than 3.1.1)  
14:12 <JuanDaugherty> np, makes sense for it all to be a common 3.2 release anyway  
14:12 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:15 <+tmortagne> s/change/chance/  
14:15 <+tmortagne> JuanDaugherty: 3.1.1 has not been released yet but it will as soon as possible this week, it has been voted already  
14:16 <JuanDaugherty> tmortagne, got it.

16:45 <vmassol> no

16:46 <vmassol> ok  
16:47 <+tmortagne> too lazy :)  
16:47 <vmassol> I can understand that ;)  
16:48 <+tmortagne> BTW guys there is a vote on the mailing list

20:08 <mflorea> has quit  
20:28 <nsa\_a1> has joined #xwiki  
20:28 <nsa\_a1> hello  
20:29 <nsa\_a1> is there ara developers?  
20:35 <nsa\_a1> please, discribe me how to initialize the singleton components?  
20:36 <@cjdelisle> When you look up the component for the first time, the component manager will initialize it.  
20:37 <nsa\_a1> Component intialized for every request?  
20:38 <@cjdelisle> no, only the first time, then it's stored in a map in the component manager.  
20:39 <nsa\_a1> I need a component that is initialized at xwiki startup  
20:39 <@cjdelisle> When writing your component, you need the @Component annotation on top of the component, the @ComponentRole annotation on the top of the interface which it implements, and the components.txt file which contains the fully qualified class name of the component, the component manager will handle the rest.  
20:40 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
20:41 <nsa\_a1> I already wrote some components  
20:41 <@cjdelisle> There is no @InitializeOnStartup annotation but you could do something like load the component on each page load so on the first page load it is guaranteed to be initialized.  
20:42 <mflorea> has quit  
20:43 <nsa\_a1> yep, i wrorte singleton component, this components used in my custom authentification, but components isitialized every time when user logged in  
20:43 <nsa\_a1> Sorry for any misspellings, my english is not good )  
20:45 <nsa\_a1> I tried integrate a xwiki width another product  
20:45 <nsa\_a1> \*with  
20:48 <nsa\_a1> during the authentication token is created for access to another system, and I have to save it for future use  
20:49 <nsa\_a1> for that, I tried use singleton component

20:51 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: it's done on my side was just waiting for green light from the mailing list  
20:51 <+tmortagne> but I'm not supposed to touch the computer at this hour without having some couple issues ;)  
20:52 <+tmortagne> checking the mailing list  
21:05 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: negotiated some time, committing right now  
21:05 <@sdumitriu> K
